title: Fairly heavy showers above 75mm likely in some places today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Central provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (24), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Robbery gang guilty of Kim Kardashian heist in Paris
byline: Eight people have been found guilty after US reality TV star Kim Kardashian was robbed at gunpoint of millions of dollars’ worth of jewellery in Paris nearly a decade ago.

title: Ukraine and Russia take part in biggest prisoner swap since 2022 invasion
byline: Russia and Ukraine have each handed over 390 soldiers and civilians in the biggest prisoner exchange since the start of the full-scale Russian invasion in 2022.

title: ‘Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema’, Malini Fonseka passes away
byline: Sri Lankan cinema icon and veteran actress Malini Fonseka, widely celebrated as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema,” has passed away this morning (24) at the age of 76,  while receiving treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.

title: 23 injured in bus accident in Nuwara Eliya
byline: Around 23 individuals have sustained injuries in an accident reported in Nuwara Eliya last night (23), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: One dead, 12 injured in bus-tipper truck collision in Weliara
byline: An accident occurred early this morning (24 May) in the Weliara area along the Colombo–Wellawaya main road, when a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus travelling from Batticaloa to Galle crashed into the rear of a tipper truck travelling ahead of it.

title: Strong magnitude 5.2 quake rattles northern NSW, Australia
byline: A 5.2-magnitude earthquake and a 4.1-magnitude aftershock have rattled parts of north-central NSW.

title: Govt. has no intention of acquiring lands from people in North and East under any circumstances – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the government has no intention of acquiring the lands owned by the people of the Northern and Eastern provinces and that the aim of the government is to promptly return land ownership to those who rightfully own them.

title: Robbery gang found guilty over Kim Kardashian heist in Paris
byline: Eight people have been found guilty after US reality TV star Kim Kardashian was robbed at gunpoint of millions of dollars’ worth of jewellery in Paris nearly a decade ago.

title: Legal unit to be established in Parliament following committee approval
byline: Due to a significant increase in litigation and legal consultations pertaining to Members of Parliament and the staff of the Parliament of Sri Lanka, the Parliamentary Staff Advisory Committee has decided to establish a Legal Unit for Parliament with the objective of providing necessary legal assistance.

title: Malini Fonseka’s last rites with state honours on Monday
byline: The final rites of veteran actress Malini Fonseka will be held with full state honours on 26 May (Monday) at Independence Square, according to the Minister of Cultural Affairs.

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake remanded
byline: Former Minister and Anuradhapura District Organiser of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), Duminda Dissanayake, has been remanded until 29 May following his arrest yesterday (23 May).

title: Weather advisory issued for heavy rainfall
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ level advisory for heavy rains in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Nuwara-Eliya, and Kandy districts, valid for the next 24 hours.

title: Former All Blacks 7s assistant coach appointed Sri Lanka Rugby head coach
byline: Rodney Gibbs, a former assistant coach of the New Zealand All Blacks Sevens team, has been appointed as the Head Coach of the Sri Lankan national rugby team.

title: Over 3,100 nurses receive appointments in Sri Lanka’s largest-ever induction
byline: Appointment letters were presented to 3,147 newly recruited members of the nursing service at the Assembly Hall of Temple Trees in Colombo today (24).

title: Sri Lanka’s wildlife rangers featured in Prince William’s new BBC docu-series
byline: Sri Lanka’s tireless wildlife defenders have taken the global spotlight in ‘Guardians’, a powerful new documentary series launched by Prince William and The Royal Foundation’s United for Wildlife.

title: Sri Lanka’s wildlife rangers featured in Prince William’s new BBC docu-series
byline: Sri Lanka’s tireless wildlife defenders have taken the global spotlight in ‘Guardians’, a powerful new documentary series launched by Prince William and The Royal Foundation’s United for Wildlife.

title: Seven injured after tipper truck crashes into SLTB bus
byline: At least seven persons have been wounded and hospitalised after a tipper truck transporting sand crashed into the rear end of an SLTB bus on the Wellawaya-Thanamalwila main road today (24).

title: ‘A true icon of Sri Lankan cinema’: President offers condolences on passing of Malini Fonseka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed his condolences following the death of veteran actress Malini Fonseka, whom he described as “a true icon of Sri Lankan cinema” whose grace and talent inspired generations.

title: Discussion held on arrangements for state funeral of Malini Fonseka
byline: The final rites of the late veteran actress and icon of Sri Lankan cinema, Malini Fonseka, will be held with state honours on Monday (26 May), at the Independence Square premises.

title: 12-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs tomorrow
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a 12-hour water cut from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. tomorrow (May 25) in several areas including Colombo.

title: Govt. is taking actions to improve healthcare facilities & professional standards – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the government is taking necessary actions to enhance the facilities and professional standard within the healthcare sector, and that expecting a compassionate discharge of duties from the nurses and midwives.

title: ‘X’ users face endless loading screens as site faces global outage
byline: X (formerly Twitter) experienced a major outage Saturday that affected thousands of users worldwide.
